intro: Pulmonaria × heinrichii, commonly known as the hybrid lungwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of velvety, hairy leaves. The plant produces tall, slender stems bearing clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink, white, and purple. It thrives in moist, shady woodland environments and is often found in the understory of deciduous forests. Pulmonaria × heinrichii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and early spring blooms.
